title: What is better than an OLED TV? - Quora

response.answer_text: MicroLED is better in every way. Brighter, more energy efficient, doesn’t burn-in, refresh rates that far exceed the retina stabbing 30Hz. Unfortunately corporations are dragging feet on this technology so they can milk OLED some more. Fun fact: yellow night shift display filters have never existed in LED LCD displays, that’s because they didn’t flicker. OLED displays flicker, that’s why it’s impossible to use at night, not because of blue light. Google “OLED flicker”

In terms of what? You can’t ask a question about “what X is better” without providing at least some context or some idea of the criteria on which this judgement should be made. I see several people claiming that “OLED is the best technology available,” but a flat statement like that isn’t very helpful or even necessarily true. What is most important in the application you’re considering? Cost? Reliability? Color accuracy? Brightness and contrast? Weight? And on and on and on…
